description:
{"blocks":[{"key":"4ptc","text":"qPCR for the quantification of Aquarickettsia spp. (Klinges et al., 2022) a putative parasite found in the coral A. cervicornis. This protocol has been altered by incorporating a recently published A. cervicornis CAM control gene (Palacio-Castro et al., 2021) targeted to detect differences across A. cervicornis genotypes because it is a single-copy gene in A. cervicornis.


","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":31,"length":21},{"style":"italic","offset":113,"length":16},{"style":"italic","offset":198,"length":14},{"style":"italic","offset":298,"length":15},{"style":"italic","offset":359,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"c1fj5","text":"PrimeTime MM - (keep in -20 for long storage) ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cb3kq","text":"Forward coral host primer (Acropora) at 10 uM (keep in -20 for long storage) - Primer sequences from https://doi.org/10.1007/s00338-021-02159-x","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dbjid","text":"Reverse coral host primer (Acropora) at 10 uM (keep in -20 for long storage) - Primer sequences from https://doi.org/10.1007/s00338-021-02159-x","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ctng","text":"Forward Aquarickettsia primer at 10 uM (keep in -20 for long storage) - Primer sequences from","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"862ri","text":"Reverse Aquarickettsia primer at 10 uM (keep in -20 for long storage) - Primer sequences from","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
manuscript_citation: {"blocks":[{"key":"ak6bn","text":"J Grace Klinges, Shalvi H Patel, William C Duke, Erinn M Muller, Rebecca L Vega Thurber, Phosphate enrichment induces increased dominance of the parasiteAquarickettsiain the coralAcropora cervicornis,FEMS Microbiology Ecology, Volume 98, Issue 2, February 2022, fiac013,https://doi.org/10.1093/femsec/fiac013","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":153,"length":14},{"style":"italic","offset":179,"length":20},{"style":"italic","offset":200,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":270,"length":38}],"data":[]},{"key":"am9li","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"72vui","text":"Palacio-Castro, A.M., Dennison, C.E., Rosales, S.M.et al.Variation in susceptibility among three Caribbean coral species and their algal symbionts indicates the threatened staghorn coral,Acropora cervicornis,is particularly susceptible to elevated nutrients and heat stress.Coral Reefs40, 1601–1613 (2021). https://doi.org/10.1007/s00338-021-02159-x","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":51,"length":6},{"style":"italic","offset":187,"length":21},{"style":"italic","offset":274,"length":11},{"style":"bold","offset":285,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"4891409BA97611ED96920A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://doi.org/10.1093/femsec/fiac013"}}}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"43t0a","text":"Remove PCR reagents from freezer and allow reagents to thaw on ice or at room temperature.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eqm9i","text":"Wipe down PCR hood with 10% bleach and ethanol. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fcv47","text":"Place consumables such as tubes, plates, plate sealers, and water in PCR hood and turn on UV light for   ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":103,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"668h5","text":"Once everything is thawed vortex PCR reagents, spin them down, and place them on ice.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8jqke","text":"Keep reagents cool or on ice during the duration of the protocol. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c7k36","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":1200,"guid":"2047F980B38A11EDB3E3A3E674080DAC","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"54gkc","text":"Prepare enough master mix for the number of reactions needed. Each combination of sample and target (gene) should be run at least in duplicates. {"blocks":[{"key":"ead36","text":"Add 8 uL of master mix to each well. Aiming for the bottom of the well will help to visualize what wells had master mix and DNA added.  ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"94s5i","text":"Add DNA to each well (2 uL). Aiming for the top of the well will help to visualize what wells had master mix and DNA added. title: qPCR assay for Aquarickettsia spp.
